New Records: De'Aaron Fox scored 109 points over a two-game span, the most in franchise history, passing DeMarcus Cousins.
There has been only one instance of someone scoring more points in a two-day span over the last 50 years, with Kobe Bryant scoring 110 points in 2007.
Key Match Events: The Kings trailed 89-78 in the third quarter but took a 118-116 lead on a Jordan McLaughlin 3-pointer with 1:04 remaining.
Both teams shot basically the same percentage from 3-point range, with the Kings making 19 of 41 shots, or 46.3%, and the Jazz shooting 12 for 26, or 46.2%.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz had five players score at least 16 points in a game for the first time this season.
DeMar DeRozan, Malik Monk, and Domantas Sabonis were sidelined for Sacramento, and Taylor Hendricks and Walker Kessler did not play for the Jazz.
Others: The Kings host the Atlanta Hawks on Monday, while the Jazz continue their five-game trip against the Los Angeles Clippers on Sunday.
